questions.question: The force which is experienced by the cores while pouring molten metal is:

explanations.a: The force experienced by cores while pouring molten metal can indeed be described as buoyant force. This force arises because the core, being less dense than the molten metal, experiences an upward force due to buoyancy. This force helps to support the core within the mould and counteracts the weight of the molten metal.

questions.question: For the casting of aluminium, chaplets used are made up of:

explanations.a: Cchaplets used for the casting of aluminum are made of aluminum. Chaplets are sacrificial metal pieces placed between the mold and core in sand casting to provide support and maintain the desired spacing. Using aluminum chaplets ensures compatibility with the molten aluminum during casting, as they will melt and integrate with the casting material without causing contamination or adverse reactions.

answers.b: To increase the permeability of the core sand
